title: John Malone on Future of Lionsgate Post #039;Hunger Games#039;
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
16 Sep 2015 02:21 AM EST 
Liberty Media Chariman John Malone says Lionsgate will be able to withstand the end of the Hunger Games. The multi-billion film series is coming to a close this November with the release of “Mockingjay – Part 2. Malone went on to note that traditional studios and television providers are in a state of flux, while praising Lionsgate’s ability to bob and weave with the times. The chairman pointed to Netflix as the main competitor in the media industry with its great balance sheet, creative staff and flexibility. During the meeting, Lionsgate CEO Jon Feltheimer outlined some of the new areas that the studio is branching into beyond film and television. Feltheimer noted that Lionsgate was backing a live “Hunger Games” stage show, a theme park ride and an exhibition tied to the film.
